text: Owler Bar is a small area of settlement and locally important road junction in Derbyshire, England. It lies at an altitude of 305 metres and is just south of the county border with Sheffield, on the edge of the Peak District National Park. It lies west of the town of Dronfield and is where the A 621, B6054 and B6051 roads meet. The junction of the roads takes the form of an unusually large roundabout, or one-way system. Despite its small size, the hamlet has two pubs: the Peacock and the Moorlands.Pubs In Owler Bar, Sheffield A cairn lies immediately north of the hamlet.The Megalithic Portal and Megalith Map: Owler Bar Cairn Notable residents have included rambler G.
